column1: Dictionaries in Python are defined using curly braces {}.
Dictionaries in Python are defined using parentheses ().
In a dictionary, keys must be immutable data types, while values can be mutable or immutable.
In a dictionary, keys can be mutable data types, while values must be immutable.
The keys() method returns a view object that contains all the keys in a dictionary.
The get_keys() method returns a list of all the keys in a dictionary.
The values() method returns a view object that contains all the values in a dictionary.
The get_values() method returns a list of all the values in a dictionary.
The items() method returns a view object that contains tuples of key-value pairs in a dictionary.
The get_items() method returns a list of tuples containing the key-value pairs in a dictionary.
You can add a new key-value pair to a dictionary using the update() method or by using the square bracket notation.
You can add a new key-value pair to a dictionary using the append() method or by using the curly brace notation.
The get() method returns the value associated with a key, or a default value if the key is not found.
The find() method returns the value associated with a key, or None if the key is not found.
The pop() method removes and returns the value associated with a specific key in a dictionary.
The remove() method removes and returns the key-value pair associated with a specific key in a dictionary.
A class is a blueprint for creating objects with predefined properties and methods.
A class is a function that creates objects with predefined properties and methods.
Objects are instances of a class, created using the class constructor.
Objects are instances of a class, created using the object() function.
Classes are defined using the class keyword, followed by the class name.
Classes are defined using the def keyword, followed by the class name and a colon.
The init() method is a special method used to initialize the attributes of a class.
The initialize() method is a special method used to initialize the attributes of a class.
The self parameter refers to the current instance of the class and is used to access its attributes and methods.
The this parameter refers to the current instance of the class and is used to access its attributes and methods.
Inheritance allows a new class to inherit attributes and methods from an existing class.
Inheritance allows an existing class to inherit attributes and methods from a new class using the inherits keyword.
The str() method is used to define a string representation of an object.
The string() method is used to define a string representation of an object.
Dictionaries are unordered collections of key-value pairs, while lists are ordered collections of elements.
Lists are unordered collections of elements, while dictionaries are ordered collections of key-value pairs.
Dictionaries are mutable, meaning their elements can be changed after creation.
Dictionaries are immutable, meaning their elements cannot be changed after creation.
Lists are accessed by their index, while dictionaries are accessed by their keys.
Dictionaries are accessed by their index, while lists are accessed by their keys.
The len() function returns the number of elements in a list or the number of key-value pairs in a dictionary.
The size() function returns the number of elements in a list or the number of key-value pairs in a dictionary.
Encapsulation is the process of bundling data and methods into a single unit, such as a class.
Encapsulation is the process of inheriting properties and methods from a parent class.
Abstraction is the process of hiding complex details and showing only essential features to the user.
Abstraction is the process of creating multiple instances of a class.
Inheritance allows a new class to inherit attributes and methods from an existing class.
Inheritance allows an existing class to inherit attributes and methods from a new class.
Polymorphism allows objects of different classes to be treated as objects of a common parent class.
Polymorphism allows a single class to have multiple constructors with different parameters.
A class is a blueprint for creating objects, while an object is an instance of a class.
An object is a blueprint for creating classes, while a class is an instance of an object.
